Reviews.Title: “Great Deal (hotwire), clean rooms, decent location. Screwed up our reservation and didnt handle it well. Other issues...”
Reviews.Author: VeraandVeronika
Reviews.Content: First the good: the place is right next to a freeway and getting to the aero port, casino and attractions was easy. Parking is free and easy too, rooms are as would be expected from a holiday inn - spacious, clean etc... After getting a great deal on Hotwire and then finding out the name of the hotel, I called to make sure that the three rooms we were getting we're connected to each other and two of them had king beds ( both of these requests were very important since we are traveling with a baby ). We were reassured that it will be all good.. They also set us up for an early checking (10am they said, unusual but a nice bonus we thought) We called to confirm that our rooms were ready and as we requested half an hour before we arrived (1-2pm), and all was good... When we arrived however we were informed by a very unapologetic person at the counter that 1) one of our rooms wasn't ready as they were overbooked.. ( we were fine with that at first but didn't turn out to be ready until way after official checkin time)...2) only one of our rooms had. King sized bad ( we were willing to live with that ) and 3) rooms weren't connected ( that part wasn't ok at all but on top of it she basically was telling us that there is no way we could have requested it- she was actually implying we were making it up)...There is nothing she could do she said.. Just like that.since our hotel was prepaid for all 4 nights,, we couldn't just leave so waited for a manager who finally got us two connecting rooms ( the third one was nearby, not connected- which was ok I guess, it had a view of some dirty roofs too and wasn't ready for hours.. We were happy though that the main issues were resolved eventually ( after probably at least 20 minutes at the counter with a crying baby, manager was trying to fix the issues as she felt parenting comradely.., checkin was off putting.. I asked what they can do for us to compensate for this drama and they told us we'd get a free breakfast the next day and a fridge/ microwave ( both were nice gestures, although it took 3 calls to actually get that, and the man who brought them finally, didn't have a splitter available, so microwave had to end up on the floor.. Odd Wireless was a real pain and i needed t to work-I travel a lot ( as u can see, I usually leave nice reviews :)), and wireless works fine, in this case I had to call them several times a day ( they had to reset, blamed my computer and refused to do anything once, and in general it was a pain.. Finally figured out that their nets confuguration couldn't play nicely and consistently with my works VPN, which isnt normally a problem.. Waste of time Last complain: when we went down for breakfast in the morning, we waited 15 minutes in a half empty .restaurant.( it's more of a bar size), and then waited 45 minutes for our food which was pretty good.. Wait stuff was nice to us but very neurotic as even my 2 year old noticed :).. They did yell at some couple that they had to wait until seated.. And I mean "bark".. Odd, we were thinking maybe erected is a convention or something in another room that they are catering... Otherwise the place is good - beds were comfortable, hot tub was nice on a rainy day ( pool wasn't heated though as their website says, but that was ok) There is food within walking distance ( a great Thai restaurant across the street, fast food, bagel shop, Starbucks). View From the 2 rooms was over the highways and hills behind it, it ws pretty nice actually. It's not really in mission valley, but I liked the location anyways,

Reviews.Title: “low prices, free parking, excellent facility, and good location”
Reviews.Author: StCharlesLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in in a great location, in tip-top condition, and has very nice ammenities. What's not to like? I have stayed here twice and my stay last week was better than my first a few months prior. That unfortunate time I had trouble getting hot water prior to a certain time in the early morning; the staff was unresponsive but I was extremely well compensated by management upon checkout. I gave them another chance last week and I was not disappointed in the least. The check-in process was fast and welcoming, and my suite was spacious and spotless. Between my two trips I have enjoyed the fitness room, the pool and hot tub, and the drinks and hot appetizers offered at the bar. Whatever problems they previously had with hot water have now been corrected. Just off the Interstate, it was convenient to travel in any direction (assuming you have GPS guidance), within a few miles of many excellent dining choices, and a truly delightful stay in every way. Housekeeping was outstanding. This hotel is also located a fraction of a mile down the road from the San Diego Chargers facility. The last time I was here I saw several of the players at various times in the hotel, and also had a nice conversation with one of their reserve linebackers at the bar downstairs. The bottom line: With its low prices, free parking, excellent facility, and good location, this is a very good choice for a pleasant stay. TIP #1 - Join the Holiday Inn frequent guest program. It offers many advantages and awards, not the least of which is free upgrades, when available. TIP #2 - If you are a light sleeper, request a room on the side away from the Interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, not in mission valley”
Reviews.Author: fndlair
Reviews.Content: This is a average Holiday Inn. It claims to be in Mission Valley it is not. That is the only real complaint I have for this place. Otherwise a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't believe this was a Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: I had read about Holiday Inn renovating their hotels but I couldn't believe the difference. Before I would only be caught dead in a Holiday Inn had the title Express after it but I have completely changed my mind. The service was EXCELLENT at the front desk. I came in grumpy after a long drive and I was greeted with fresh baked cookies and a smile. Then, just because we are loyalty program members they upgraded us to a suite. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. I was surprised to find that they had room service and a restaurant with an amazing breakfast. Plus a pantry for any little items you might have left behind. We didn't get to take advantage of the fitness center or pool which I was hoping to do but I imagine they would have exceeded my expectations as everything else at this hotel did. The best part was that with our AAA discount, our room was only $108! A steal for what we received. We'll definitely consider this hotel again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKeenerYDM
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was impressed from start to finish with the San Diego Holiday Inn Mission Valley. The outside of the building doesn't speak to the dynamic hotel and staff inside. I loved the lobby and the new take on the Holiday Inn theme. Also the staff in the Rayo Bar was terrific and very friendly. The rooms were spacious and they have free wireless internet access which was easy to get on to. The staff were all very friendly and went out of the way to help us during the meeting we attended there. Kudos to the team at this Holiday Inn in San Diego, CA. They really did everything to make the stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Two great stays!”
Reviews.Author: Renee0724
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property two times in the past three weeks. Both visits I had great service in all area's of the hotel. I highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to or through San Diego. The hotel is located in a great area to be able to get to the things you want within just a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as usual”
Reviews.Author: littlerubiez
Reviews.Content: I have never had a bad stay at a Holiday Inn. I booked this one very last minute over Labor Day weekend and got a great price. The hotel was nicely remodeled, clean, and the staff was friendly. Check in was a breeze. It's in a good location too, not in the busy downtown of San Diego, but about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chrisneetz
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great service and good rates. Smart decision.

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional Management”
Reviews.Author: feldtj
Reviews.Content: We actually didn't spend the entire night here but had a very good experience. After checking in they left a message on my cell phone saying they had an urgent situation and needed our room. Upon returning the call I was informed that they needed a large block of rooms for s sports team and asked if we would be willing to give up our room in exchange for free lodging at a different area hotel. Linda and Julie were very helpful in getting us to the other hotel and took care of crediting our account and setting up payment at the other hotel. It turned out to be a great deal for our family and the other hotel they put us up in was very nice. In the limited time we were in the hotel and room we were left with a very good impression. It was very clean and modern. If ever in the San Diego area again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: TheShadow32
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and the room was very nice. We were upgraded to a suite due to our status. There was not a safe in the room which my wife was used to having in a room. However, they do store some things at the service desk which was nice. The bed was fairly comfortable and the restaurant was pretty good for dinner. We were able to get the PointsBreak deal which was awesome for this hotel in San Diego. Its close to the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Odd location, great find”
Reviews.Author: Mexico805
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really in Mission Valley but nearby and you basically enter through a strip mall but beyond that it was great. Looks like it was recently renovated. My room was very comfortable and spacious. Hotel was quite full during the visit but service was excellent with good food and a nice lounge. I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again. Great Food, Friendly Staff, Clean and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TimNewman1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels but none that had the quality of food this place did. The El Rayo Grill was simply awesome. I loved every meal I had there. My room was clean and comfortable - nothing fancy. The service though was spectacular. The housekeeping staff did a great job and were very friendly. Front Desk was also very good at what they did in anticipating my needs. I like having the USA Today under my door and being able to watch on-demand movies from my room. The pool was also clean and refreshing. This hotel had a great location, only about 15 minutes from the airport and lots of shopping nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: zinman6547
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed nice. Nice amenties, nice new clean looking room. At work the next morning I started noticing bites all over my arms and torso. Little clusters of red welts. Went to Kaiser as soon as I could and doctor said it looked like bed bug bites. Thank god not Scabies! I took every precaution when I got home not to infect my home. I threw all my clothes right in the dryer on high and threw the bag in the garbage (I had read that sometimes they can infect luggage and they can't survive over 120 degree heat). Called the manager of the hotel and he couldn't get me off the line fast enough. He was barely civil. Probably thought I was going to sue, but I just wanted to warn them so no on else would have to go through what I had....

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dafried
Reviews.Content: Due to problems at another hotel, had to find a new place late in the evening. Â Holiday Inn Mission Valley was able to find 2 adjoining rooms for us. Â We were very pleased with the hotel and staff. Â We would gladly stay here again. Customer service was the best. Â As an example, I wasÂ given bottle of water at front desk because we had to wait 'so long'. Â It wasn't long although gesture was nice and 'wait' was caused because front desk was working successfully to accommodate another guests request. Positives - pillow choices - room size - workout room - size and equipment - pantry with water for sale for $1 - bed quality - location - proximity to restaurants, freeway, etc Negatives - road noise in some rooms - older AC units - Old tube TVs - perfectly workable - parking spots are small (seems pervasive in San Diego) - sink area is small

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable Employees-Not Ideal for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Kate2944
Reviews.Content: PROBLEM 1 - I stayed in Holiday in for 2 days business trip. When I check-out I requested assistance from the front desk and they sent me a security guard. I gave the guard a tip and 2 important priority main packages to be sent out the same day which is monday. 7 days later my priority package did not arrive. So I decided to track my package and realize that Holiday Inn Front desk has still have my package and not sent it out. I track again the next day and that is when the records indicates that the packages left that day and no one in the hotel can figure out why my 2 packages was sitting in their hotel for 7 days. So I missed an important document that was due to be turn in. So tip to everyone, DO NOT RELY on the employees to take care of your important packages. Better yet, stay away from this hotel. PROBLEM 2 - I left my iPad charger in the wall while charging it so I called front desk and housekeeping to mail it to my home. No response and no answer in the Lost and Found Department. After leaving 4 messages, they finally called me back and confirmed that they do have my charger. However, I was not able to answer my call so they left a message to call them back to arrange pick-up. I called them back for more than 10 times in the last 3 weeks and still do not have a call from the hotel to assist me with my charger. VERY UNRELIABLE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place With A Few Minor Annoyances”
Reviews.Author: mwkeplin
Reviews.Content: We just finished up a stay here and I can say that I would go back to the Holiday Inn Mission Valley. I stayed 5 Holiday Inns and Holiday Inn Xpress' over the 2 weeks I was in CA and this was the only hotel that offered a room upgrade for having Priority Club Platinum status. The staff here genuinely seems to care about problems but I think that some of the problems that I experienced are just out of their control. When we first checked I went to take a shower and the water was cold after running for approx 2 minutes. We called the front desk and they said that they would have maintenance look at it. That seemed to help but several hours later my wife went to take a shower and the water was cold again. So we called the front desk and they had maintenance work on it again. This helped but it was just a temporary measure. I finally learned that if I let the hot water run full flow for about 5 minutes it would finally warm up. Aggravating and wasteful but it worked. The room itself was fine and the bed was comfortable. The pool area was basic but clean and the water was comfortable. One problem here (at least in our room) was road noise from cars, large trucks, and motorcycles late at night on Murphy Canyon Road. But overall based on the staff and cleanliness of the hotel I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Guest Experience”
Reviews.Author: rjervin81
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and customer service is very important to me. As soon as I walked into the hotel lobby I was greeted by the front desk staff. I was in San Diego for work and it was my first time visiting. The staff was very knowledgeable about the area and gave me great dinner recommendations and highlighted some hot spots downtown that I should not miss â€“ including the Ocean Beach Pier. I had a busy travel week and needed a haircut and was not able to schedule one while I was home, the desk staff found a place just across from the hotel and even called and checked their availability for me. I am not always impressed with hotel food and typically dine out, however I did eat at the Rayo Grill a couple of times during my stay and I was extremely impressed. The restaurant had a very diverse menu: food was prepared to perfection and the service was top notch. I had a late night flight returning home and the hotel allowed me to check out late so I did not have to go to the airport early. This hotel is located just north of downtown San Diego and has quick interstate access to downtown without having to pay the higher price to be downtown. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I am returning to San Diego in September and I already booked my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mr.jimcat
Reviews.Content: Unexpected treatment. First room we were assigned to smelled like smoke.. they moved us right away, even brought us a fridge and microwave. Free WI Fi in the rooms as well. Lobby, very attractive. Did think the restaurant was over priced for the food portions. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “The Best WEEEKEND EVER”
Reviews.Author: sreed7
Reviews.Content: It was great stay, Service was outstanding, there couldnt be more to ask for , the staff was great and hard working!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: smiles881
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Holiday Inn San Diego in Mission Valley in March of 2010. I would definetly stay there again and recommend this place to my friends. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Nice to know there are still good employees and a clean place to stay. We will be in San Diego for Super Cross this year and we as well as our friends will be staying here at this hotel. Thanks for a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Noise Noise Noise”
Reviews.Author: MikeInSandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 111 which should never be used. Across the hall is meeting room 110 that has meetings until 9:30 pm. Behind my wall is the motors to the elevators which run all night and out my window is a busy road. The internet was horribly slow, and parking was horrible. Almost every vehicle was over the line due to improper sizing of the parking spaces to make it appear they have a lot of parking space. If not for these major problems the Hotel would be decent. In the future I will not stay in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marci2123
Reviews.Content: i booked a room for family that was coming to town. I was very satisfied with the hotels parking, decor, cleanliness and staff. The hotel was very well kept and the room was nice and tidy, well stocked and they made sure we had a fridge and microwave in the room as we requested. Gerrie checked us in and she personally made sure that these were in the room before we got to the room. all of the staff that we encountered had smiles and were very helpful if we needed something. This was the second time booking a room here and the rates and staff make it a great place to have my family stay when coming to town.

Reviews.Title: “I was very dissatisfied with the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: maryjo08
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because it was very close to someone that I was visiting. From day one the lavatory sink drain was clogged and the water just laid in the sink until I left, also the counter around the sink was very small and water just laid on the counter which made it dangerous to use the coffee maker. IMPORTANT-They didn't have a microwave or a refrigerator for use in the room. They had a restaurant in the hotel that I guess they wanted you to eat at although it was expensive. Fortunately there was a "Jack-In-A-Box" next door where I could get a cup of coffee and something to eat at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: gezra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of nowhere miles away from downtown San Diego, even the cab driver had no idea where it was. The public areas are dark and gloomy and the food is awful. The bedrooms however were acceptable. The hotel contracts out rooms to local shipyard workers who monopolise the bar at night. The feel of the whole place was very downmarket, would not recommend in any way, shape or form

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jamers21
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was very pleasant. Hotel staff and even all house keeping staff were very friendly and accommodating. Entire hotel was very recently remodeled so it looked, felt and smelled new. Room was very clean, quiet, and modern. Pool and hot tub were in very nice condition as well and are heated (hot tub a little too much actually). Great location - in the middle of just about everything in San Diego. The only shortfalls were the slow (but free!) internet and no continental breakfast. For a meager price on Priceline it was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Value”
Reviews.Author: Filstyle
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel in Feb. and it's pretty nice. Staff were great and the restaurant was awesome. Awesome price for room. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel far exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NacholovesElvis
Reviews.Content: This was the first overnight stay for us in San Diego (we're from LA, so usually we drive right back home). For the cost, I expected an average hotel in terms of decor, comfort, and cleanliness, but was very pleasantly surprised to find this place newly remodeled (very cute and modern) and very clean. The bed and bedding in the room was comparable to a very high end hotel (like the "Heavenly" beds at a certain hotel). The front desk staff were sooo nice and friendly. Didn't realize how close it was to everything, including Barona, which was only a 10 min trip. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Jaded by one bad night”
Reviews.Author: jjw77
Reviews.Content: Got this room through Hot Wire. Initial impressions were ok. Was placed next to a room with some type of generator in the room next door. Complained but was told there was no other room available. Couldn't sleep because of the constant vibration. Awful sleep. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: trucknaintez
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn on Murphy Canyon Rd. is a hidden GEM! Wes the GM.is a nice guy friendly,TheFrontdesk Team are great&friendly.Micelle@the restaurtantbar is awsome!!! The wholeTeam there is GREAT!!! So plan your stay here when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jan56chevy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Holiday bowl. Everyone there was nice and heipful. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was great and nice that we didn't have to go find some other place to eat. I forgot my book in the room and they sent it to me within a week. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer focused”
Reviews.Author: thriftychic
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived at this hotel in San Diego late in the evening. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a corner suite in the updated section of this hotel. We were given extra pillows and a welcome package of cookies and water for our children. During our stay, the cleaning staff went above and beyond by leaving extra towels and arranging the towels in fun designs that delighted my teenage girls. In addition, I found the front desk staff to be friendly and attentive to my families every need.

Reviews.Title: “Our suitcases were opened and our things were stolen- by staff!”
Reviews.Author: janplus4
Reviews.Content: One daughter left her jewelry out on the TV during the day when we were gone. Dumb? Yes! But, it should not have been stolen. Expensive jeans were stolen out of my suitcase also. Who knows what else was taken that we have not even noticed. It would be easy for hotel management to tell who entered our room as it is a card key. They refuse! We lost over $200 of our stuff and they will do nothing about it. I would never ever stay here again. We have received the run around these last 3 months. I always leave my suitcase so I will know if anyone opened it. Sure enough, while we were out and the room was cleaned, it was opened. If you have to stay here, lock all your belongings. Just horrible!

Reviews.Title: “good for a quick overnight”
Reviews.Author: mrsanderson
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline...nice large rooms, especially the bathroom. Clean but view was of the roof and air conditioners. Not a problem, you get what you pay for. Convenient to 15 fwy and most San Diego attractions and airport...just what we needed. Peeved that the room had a small coffee maker but only 1 serving of decaf and no sugar or cream. Didn't bother to ask for more as we were headed out anyway....there are coffee places everywhere! Some dining nearby, mostly fast food type...Walmart close also. Lobby personnel very nice and friendly. Saw people eating in the restaurant but didn't as we were on the move! Safe location...good price on Priceline.....just as we expected....did not experience problems listed on previous reviews. Internet in the buisness center was $5 for 15 minutes but you could print airline boarding passes for free...wifi in lobby free but you are crouched up with your laptop on your lap...did not use the inroom service. Parking was free and available but tight spots....large vehicles might have a bit of a squeeze.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty shabby hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: JakeAdman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, check in and service were good. Hotel was very basic, room had a single towel, bed was OK, fixtures were basic. Workout room is old, machines broken or very old models. Very short walk to various restaurants which is a plus. Good central location for my business activities. If you can get a great rate then it is OK to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff performance”
Reviews.Author: llloydxmas
Reviews.Content: Prepaid for this hotel and showed up for a late check-in and they gave me the run around for 45 minutes saying they had no rooms left. Finally got a room but this experience was ridiculous and soured the entire stay. Rooms were okay but overpriced for what you received. Parking was difficult in the tiny spaces either in the garage or in the small parking lot. Room was quiet and moderately comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with awesome service and a remodeled restaurant”
Reviews.Author: SpikeyHead630
Reviews.Content: So I got the hotel on priceline for 50 bucks on a Sunday night, but was a little scared based on some of the reviews I read on here. It seemed like it was either hit or miss. I was pleasantly suprised at how great it was! My roommate and I came from LA for a quick getaway to visit some friends. There is plenty of free parking, and the hotel is right by all kinds of restaurants, fast food joints, and a supermarket. Upon entering the front desk girl greeted us and she literally took care of all of needs: she offered a room away from the freeway so there would be minimal noise, offered us two beds, told us the opening and closing times of their brand new restaurant, gave us a map of the san diego zoo, told us about their pool and spa, let us know exactly where our room was... She was awesome! She also let us know that there was free wifi in the lobby and she gave me a cable for my laptop so I could have internet in my room. There was a five dollar charge for the cable, but it is SO worth it! The hotel is a short drive from the beach or downtown, but I think it's worth it since we got free parking and free internet. That saved us 40 bucks right there! Some people wrote how the window of their room was messed up and all kinds of weird things in their reviews, but our room was perfect! Crisp linens, super clean bathroom, it was great! Check out was a breeze, and I would totally stay again! The value was unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but noisy”
Reviews.Author: vwjettadriver1
Reviews.Content: We Pricelined this place and it was cheap and close to zoo etc. They had remodeled some of the floors, but Priceline users don't get those rooms. Window was broken and gaping open- which really helped to keep out the horrible screeching noise the rooftop airconditioners were making 24/7 (ajacent to our window). Water damage around window frame and wall from window being broken for so long. Wish this place hadn't been our last night there. That being said-still decent for the priceline money.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel and priceline”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I use Priceline often when travelling to San Diego, and when choosing the Mission Valley area I always get this hotel. This place is definitely NOT a 3 star hotel. The plumbing is bad, the electricity is weird (i.e. flickering lights, TV's do not work properly) and though some of the staff is friendly, it seems as though they are trained to lie. They will claim they have to persent whatever situation you may have to a different department, and that said department will contact you WHICH NEVER HAPPENS. This hotel is a scam and it is more like a 2 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Money Hungry”
Reviews.Author: babyk1525
Reviews.Content: Money Hungryâ€¦ We have stayed in this hotel three times. The first time was great. The second time the hotel charged us twice. The front desk had made a mistake and could not correct it without talking to the accounting office. They were suppose to call us the next day. That never happened. We had to call them. When trying to get our money back the hotel was non responsive. They finally, after four days of trying to get a hold of the hotel accounting department, they answered the phone. They wanted us to send our bank records and identification cards in order to get our refund. This last time, we stayed at the hotel only because we brooked it through Priceline.com. It was on the name your price portion. Once we got the reservation, we decided to try it out once more. But true to the last time, we got a hidden charged by the hotel. This time there was a smoking charge. WE DONâ€™T SMOKE!! How can there be a smoking charge if we donâ€™t smoke??? We feel like this hotel is only out for our money. Every time we called or went to the front desk, the front desk person was quick to point out that we purchased our reservation through priceline.com. There was no warning about the smoking charge, the hotel just went ahead and charged our account the amount of $150.00. This is outrageous especially because we donâ€™t smoke. Please be advised donâ€™t stay at this Holiday Inn. They will find any reason to charge you money without telling you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: btowndude
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay via Priceline and got a very good rate! Like the last reviewer, I was worried about this hotel, given the recent reviews. But, I was surprised and pleased with my stay. LOCATION: The hotel is closer to Kearney Mesa and Miramar MCAS. It is not close to the shopping area and the other hotels of Mission Valley. It is close to the stadium, however, if you are going to a football game there. I needed to go to the Sports Arena, Mission Bay, and the Wild Animal Park on this trip. The hotel location provided easy access to the metro San Diego freeways. SERVICE: I called ahead to confirm my reservation, asking for a king bed and a room away from the freeway. The reservation clerk was very cordial as were the front desk staffers, when I checked it. There are no bellhops, but luggage carts are available. CHECK IN TIPS: 1. There is no large Holiday Inn sign. Mapquest or Google Maps the location before you depart. It is on the northeast corner of Aero Drive and Murphy Canyon. You will see the Jack in the Box, before you see the first driveway into the Holiday Inn. But don't take the first driveway! 2. Instead go to the second or back driveway off of Murphy Canyon Road. Then, make two right turns and enter the basement garage. Park and use the elevator to go to the first floor and check at the front desk. Then grab a luggage cart and go back to your car to unload your bags. INTERNET: It is free and fast. If you need an ethernet cord, the front desk will provide one for a $5 deposit, refundable when it is returned. NEGATIVES: 1. Stains on the carpets - given the closeness of the hotel to the stadium, I was not surprised at the number of stains in the carpet. The hotel rooms have probably seen numerous football parties. 2. Outside Noise - One side of the hotel faces the freeway and the other side faces a street that access a business park. A civil aviation airport and a marine corp air station are nearby. The windows are single pane, so expect some noise. The a/c and my white noise machine masked the outside noise for me. 3. Inside Noise - Thin walls, no noise insulation, wide gaps around the door allowed noise from within the hotel to be noticeable. There was a very loud child who was five rooms away on first night! Fortunately, the child fell asleep early and woke up late. :) I would stay at this hotel again, if I win another Priceline bid of $54!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: DBA222
Reviews.Content: Their customer service is awful. I spent a week trying to resolve a cancellation issue and they were almost totally unresponsive. I gave up and paid the bill and found out that they overcharged me. I spent two weeks trying to get them to fix the bill without success. I finally had to get my credit card company involved and the threat of non-payment got them to correct the bill. I have never received any kind of apoolgy for the overbilling.

Reviews.Title: “It was good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: vegasvalley
Reviews.Content: It was about 10-15 mins from the main attractions (Sea World, Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Downtown, etc). The freeway noise wasn't too bad. It did smell a little bit in the lobby area, but not bothersome. Washer/Dryer on the 4th floor, but bring your own detergent. FREE ample parking. Staff were nice. I actually liked this stay better than Downtown, where I paid $20 parking per day. Sizzlers, McDonalds, Wal-Mart, Frys, Jack-in-the-Box, gas station nearby. McDonalds closed at 8pm though.

Reviews.Title: “Your typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: Yet another Holiday Inn from Priceline. Fine hotel. Saw all of the signs apologizing for the mess during the remodeling. One elevator was out of service. Even with some sort of marathon or something that was going on & had booked the hotel up it didn't cause many delays. Room was your typical basic Holiday Inn. 2 beds, desk, upholstered chair, tv, bathroom with sink outside of the room with the toilet & tub. We actually had a room that faced the freeway. Perhaps it was because we had the AC running, but we didn't notice freeway noise. The entrance & parking area were a bit tight. The driveway that's down below the level of the neighboring Jack-In-The-Box was a bit tight, but we just used the back drive to come & go. The location worked really well for us. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: To start with, the hotel wouldn't let us check in until 3pm even though I have a hard time believing that no rooms were available until that time. The front desk person was rude when we checked in and refused to stop the delivery of the USA Today that we did not want. The hotel smelled funky with the restaurant smelling particularly bad. The internet connection is wired in the room and slow - too slow to even watch a 30 second video clip. The sheets in the room had holes in them and so did the curtains. There was also a large stain on the carpet. However, the worst part of the stay was the hotel's utter disregard of people with disabilities. During our stay at the hotel, there was a football team also staying there. Some of the players parked their vehicles in the disabled parking spots even though they clearly were not disabled and had no disabled decals or tags. When I reported this to hotel management, they didn't care. Hotel security said they couldn't do anything because the hotel allowed it. If the Holiday Inn does not respect the needs of people with disabilities then they will not get my business. Finally, this hotel is misleadingly named. It is not in the main Mission Valley area where all the other hotels, restaurants and shops are located. Rather, it is several freeway exits north of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior1958
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, through priceline excellent value $77 all in). provided 2 queens and extra $10 for cot - awesome! Great location, close to shopping, airport and port. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of freeway side of hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahnion777
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Standard Holiday Inn fare. -Free Internet -Close to Wal-Mart -Close to Freeway Cons: -Freeway side is quite noisy. I'm a deep sleeper and I still felt it was pretty dang loud. Not ridiculous loud, but enough to bother me while i'm lying there trying to go to sleep -Bed was a little firm for me. Courtyards and Residence Inns have softer beds. -Parking is a bit of an issue. Instead of double white line dividers, they're single, and quite compact, so if theres a suburban parked in one spot, unless you drive a small car, you won't be able to fit in. Neutral: -Construction was going on in parking garage and lobby floor but didn't create a disturbance for me. Overall: Standard Holiday Inn fare. Decent room, decent price, decent stay. Stay away from the freeway side if you can, but won't ruin your stay if you do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let the Bad Reviews Scare You”
Reviews.Author: scurryalong32
Reviews.Content: I am actually at the room right now and I have to say that its a pretty nice room. I am actually here for one night, but It would not be bad to stay here for more than one night. The lobby is modern, clean and the staff is nice. The room is clean and the bed is comfy.....I don't know what the people were complaining about. Its not a 4 or 5 star establishment, but this hotel does not deserve some of the bad reviews that it has received either.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: alanbintn
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Not all rooms have refrigerators as is advertised, fournd a good deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “No holiday here!”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: This was last minute trip so we did a Priceline search and this is the first time we have ever been disappointed in one of their properites. It is indeed a motel. It is listed as Mission Valley but so far from anything it isn't worth the difference in cost. It is the most poorly constructed property in which we have ever stayed. We heard the neighbor above moving in at 1:00am and it sounded like an elephant stomping about. The alarm went off in the room next door at 5:00 am and it continued to buzz for the next 90 minutes. It sounded as if it were in our room. The friendly accomodating front desk staff is the only positive of this property. We booked two nights and ended up leaving after one.! For what we paid for two nights we could have stayed at any 4 star property in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, it's an OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Melanie28
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the very last hour before check-in (problem with another place we were supposed to stay at), got a good price and so we didn't have too many complaints. The front desk staff was friendly and hotel was in a very convenient location - close to freeway and attractions. We were literally 5 minutes to an outdoor shopping center (Target, Nordstrom Rack, Macy's, etc.), and numerous restaurants. As the previous reviewer said, the hotel rooms are kinda dark and dreary. The bathroom was decent but toilet looked like it could have been cleaned better. My family always brings alcohol and wipes things down before we use it and we had to do that here. The carpet seemed a little dirty, we had 2 queen beds in our room but the beds seem lopsided from too much wear and tear. The hotel gives you a couple small bottles of shampoo/conditioner + bar of soap, but that was it as far as free toiletries. The swimming pool was small and not inviting so we didn't use it. If I recall correctly, the fitness center has about 5 machines. The parking lot in the back is pretty large so I wish they provided free parking. But, it wasn't too bad, $12/day. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but I would try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “An aveage hotel”
Reviews.Author: redanteater
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn San Diego - Mission Valley was an ok hotel, and meets the needs if you need a place to stay. We stay as part of a business trip - the hotel is relatively clean, but the overall appearance is dark and drury. The room was clean, other than a huge stain on the carpet right as we entered the room. As in most hotels, all the amenities were right there and available. The only major problem I had was at the restaurant during breakfast - it was impossible to get service, they did not respond to my requests, and took forever to take my payment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: AuburnAlum97
Reviews.Content: Don't do it! If you are going to San Diego, pay the extra money to stay in the Gaslamp District. This Holiday Inn should have been called a motel instead of a hotel. Don't let the photos of the lobby fool you like they did me! It wasn't clean enough ...the shower curtain had makeup or something all over it and te toilet was not the cleanest either. I actually went to Target and bought Lysol to spray the room! It is in the middle of town but it is in the middle of a bunch of strip clubs. This has turned me off of Holiday Inn for good.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected, but very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Utah8
Reviews.Content: Location - We booked through Priceline and were expecting a property closer to Sea World in the hotel circle area. Oh well. The hotel is located right next to I-15 within a professional business park. You can hear the freeway from inside the rooms at the back of the hotel. This wasn't a problem for us, but it could be for some guests, especially if you want to use the little patio of the suites. It is only a few minute drive to Charger Stadium. And Sea World/Mission Bay is convenient by I-15 to I-8, but at 15-20 minutes it was a little further than we wanted. Service - the best thing about this hotel is the friendly staff. From the moment we arrived they all were very accommodating. They worked us in to adjoining rooms and every staff member greeted us in a sincere and friendly way. Restaurant - all the kids were free at the restaurant. The breakfast buffet was really good and consisted of scrambled eggs, toast, french toast, sausage, bacon, biscuits and gravy, cold cereals, juices, milk, fruit, as well as a great omelet and waffle bar. Breakfast is served until 11:00 am, unless its not busy, then they may close it down early. But you can order the pretty much the same things from the menu. Besides the restaurant in the hotel, there is a Jack-in-the-Box burger place, a Sizzler restaurant and a Papa Johns pizza place next door. There is a grocery store and a Mexican food place a block away as well. Facilities - The lobby, lounge and restaurant were clean and pleasant. The pool area was clean, but we didn't use the facility so I can't rate the pool or hot tub. It is outside next to the street although its fairly well screened. The fitness room is very small with one each of 4 or 5 pieces of equipment including a treadmill. I chose to do my running outside on the very hilly streets. It was a pleasant place to run. There was plenty of free parking; we never had any trouble finding a spot in the covered area next to the elevator. Rooms - We started with 2 suites on opposite sides of the hotel. The suites are located on the corners of the hotel. They have a little triangular balcony off the living room. They have one bed in the bedroom and a hide-away in the living room. There are 2 TVs, a microwave and small fridge. The staff was great to move us to a suite with an adjoining room when it became available. This was perfect for our large family of eight. The beds, however, were very uncomfortable. My wife and I woke up with very sore backs every morning. General - Priceline lists this hotel as a 3 star property. When you consider that the Double Tree downtown is also rated a 3 star, it makes you wonder a bit. This hotel is not near that level of quality, but it was fine for us and our six kids. My biggest complaint is that once past the lobby area, the rooms needed some updating and better cleaning. There was mold along some of the caulk joints in the bath tub. Some of the chrome fixtures had corrosion showing through. One of the drapes was torn a bit. The sink was cracked. The doors between rooms need the hinges lubricated as they creeked loudly when moved. The door stop on the hinge was pushed through the back of the door. It wasn't so bad though because we didn't have to worry about the kids so much. Overall this hotel was less than we were expecting, but not bad. I give it a mild recommendation and wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & New Look!”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: Ok, now I wish I would have written a re- view for the last 4 times we have stayed here! They were at the beginning of re-doing the hotel last I wrote about it in 2005 I think it was....and yes...it is done and it never was THAT bad to start with. Look you guy's, you can't beat the price, It is a nice hotel, you have a bar & restaurant with GREAT prices and lot's of GOOD restaurants in the area! Great parking (undercover you guy's... for no EXTRA charge) try other hotels get a better price and then see if you don't pay an additional $10-$20 a day folks!!!!!!! For parking!!!! You don't know that when booking on line for an in expensive hotel with all the frills, next to all the attractions and wanting the bang for your buck. Oh what a surprise when you get hit for parking (and it's not covered to boot) no retaurant inside with good prices or a bar. This hotel is great for the business traveler or the leisure traveler having fun. After traveling and staying in hotels all across southeren CA to L.A. for years mainly for business (days on end every week) I think I get a birds eye view of whats hot and whats not. You get first time travelers for leisure (that have this golden picture I guess of what a hotel SHOULD be for the price) they got at bottom dollar and expect a golden castle? Hotels in any large city are not going to be the jack pot, you have hundreds of people in and out of the hotels daily.. This hotel is way under rated for some of the re-views I have read here and I am horrified to read. The hotel is great, the staff is great. It is not a rat hole. I hope and pray everytime I go to priceline I get this hotel for work or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value at discounted price”
Reviews.Author: Retropia
Reviews.Content: This is an older Holiday Inn that is good in some places, and a little lacking in others. Overall, it is a decent value if you can get it at a discounted price. Value - through Priceline, I was able to book this hotel for a three night stay 12/1-4/2006 at $45 a night. Including taxes and fees, it came to $158.85. I think this is a good value for a decent hotel in San Diego. At the regular price listed on the Holiday Inn website of $119 a night, I would prefer a newer, nicer property. Amenities - there is a small restaurant and bar, which I didn't try. They also have a small outdoor pool and spa which looked sparkling clean. However, I felt it was too chilly to use an outdoor pool during my stay. I'd have prefered an indoor pool in December. They also have a small fitness center. In the room, there is a coffee maker, ironing board and iron, hair dryer, two phones, plus an ethernet plug for free high-speed internet access. There were no ethernet cables in the room, but you can borrow a cable from the front desk. There is no wireless internet access in the rooms, although I was told it is available in the lobby for a fee. Mechanicals - the older Amana HVAC unit was noisy, because the plastic grill buzzed against the housing. I fixed it by partially loosening the cover. Doing that, I noticed that the foam air filter was dirty; it should be cleaned more often. The toilet sometimes required multiple flushes, which reminded me of early low-flow toilet design. There was plenty of hot water and water pressure for the shower. It had a shower-massage head that took me three days to figure out the "normal" setting. The shower surround and faucet looked dated, but everything worked. The sink and faucet just outside the bathroom looked new, and had a granite counter. Decor / comfort - it looked like the room had been redecorated within the last couple of years, with new furniture, carpet, bed linens, curtains and wall coverings. The bed linens and towels were nice, and each bed had four pillows. Noise - you could definitely hear hallway noise, such as people talking and doors opening and closing. It wasn't busy during my stay, so this wasn't a big issue for me. The HVAC fan helped mask noise, but it was controlled by a thermostat and thus turned on and off. This hotel is just off a freeway; I could hear a little traffic noise if I focused on it, but it didn't bother me. Security - the neighborhood seems safe and I didn't notice any problems during my stay. However, a relative works across the street and they have had some car thefts and break-ins in the past. That business has beefed up its security and now looks like Fort Knox. I'm no expert and don't want to go into specifics on a public website, but the security could be improved at this Holiday Inn. Parking - the main entry driveway is narrow and winding, as another poster mentioned. If you're driving a large motorhome or towing a trailer, I'd recommend you use the second entrance, which takes you around the back of the hotel. There is a handy lower-level covered parking lot in back, with an elevator to access the rooms. Parking is also limited around the entry, but abundant in the back. I found the individual parking spaces to be smaller than what I'm used to, which seems to be typical throughout San Diego. Staff / service - I had good interaction with the staff. The front desk staff was helpful providing driving directions, and housekeeping kept the room looking great. Every day I had fresh sheets, towels, soap and shampoo, and coffee packets. Location - it is conveniently located off of I-15 and Aero Drive. There is a Jack-in-the-Box restaurant next door along with a small strip shopping center that contains a Kinkos and a few other restaurants. If you cross to the other side of Aero Drive, you'll find a grocery store, Wal-Mart and other stores. It didn't seem particularly close to the stadium. View - I had to take a photo of the view out of my second-floor room, which provided a scenic vista of the HVAC units arrayed across an expanse of rooftop of the restaurant and lobby. I especially enjoyed the artfully placed, crushed aluminum beverage can, thoughtfully tossed out a window by a previous guest. I was amused and not bothered, as I wasn't there to look out the window, and it is fairly typical of older Holiday Inns. However, if I was paying full price, I'd ask for a room with a nicer view. In conclusion - I would stay here again at this price, and recommend it to others with the cautions noted above. If any of the negatives I mentioned are really important to you, I'd recommend staying at a newer property.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, paid $56 a night through Priceline, reg price would have been $115 a night. It was a value deal at $56 I would have been disappointed in the room at $115. I would stay there again at the reduced rate. Good location 15 minutes from Sea World. Pool was small but the kids had fun. Good value at under $60 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay/Great Price”
Reviews.Author: markobear1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights in January 2006. The hotel front desk staff were professional and prompt. The rooms were good, nothing fancy but very comfortable. The housekeeping staff did their job well. We did not eat in the hotel but we peeked in and the facilities looked clean. The hotel is not brand new and some areas look a little worn but not shabby. We felt that, especially for the price though one of those dotcoms, the stay was very comfortable and a great!!! value. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cancel your reservation!”
Reviews.Author: LVJonJ
Reviews.Content: For a Holiday Inn property, which are usually clean and comfortable - this one needs a serious remodel! I made the reservation on Priceline, next time I will take my loss and lose my prepayment rather then staying at this property. I called ahead and let them know I made the reservation on Priceline and I heard bad things about the rooms, the manager on duty advised me she would take good care of us and the room would be nice. The same manager checked us in - in to a room with a bed that needed to be replaced last year, a telephone that was missing half of the buttons, a toliet seat that was chipped - a room in general dis-repair - and not the cleanest either! You would have thought after calling ahead and them knowing we might complain if there was a problem (which I did not), that they would atleast try and get us in a nice room. No luck. The doors are old and leave a big gap below, this means you will hear serious noise from neighbors also. The pool was not heated as described and the hot-tub was a bit chilly - also a bunch of kids partying in the pool that no one cared about. This is not a 3 star property as described. Take your loss and try another property.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came down for a Chargers game and chose this hotel due to its proximity. While I can't fault the service, which was friendly,efficient, and courteous, I won't be staying here again. The room was not well-maintained by hosekeeping. We stayed two nights in a suite and had to call down for shampoo when we first got there. The towels weren't replaced the next day and we had to call for those. No coffee was provided for day two either. There was only one bar of soap which made it difficult since the sink was in a separate area from the shower. Only one trash can for the two rooms and it was not in the bathroom. The shower did not drain properly and we ended up standing in a foot of water when we wanted to shower. The restaurant was extremely slow because they underestimated the volume of orders they would receive on New Year's Evening (the day of the CHargers game.) When I informed, as requested by a comment card placed in the room, that I wouldn't be giving them an excellent rating, I was offered free breakfast. Since we didn't have 2 additional hours to dine in their restaurant, we passed. All in all, being close to the stadium didn't make up for the shoddy service that we received at significant cost.

Reviews.Title: “I don't see what the problems are!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreandmore
Reviews.Content: I got this room through Priceline for $50/night during the Christmas season, but then I was so scared to stay here after reading the reviews posted on TripAdvisor. I don't see where the negative reviews are coming from! I had no problems whatsoever. Check-in was a breeze, the clerk was really nice. We needed a refrigerator in the room because we had to keep milk cold for our 4-month old baby. Before we even got to our room with our bags, there was a person standing outside the door with the refrigerator, who happily brought it in, hooked it up, and got it going for us. There was barely any noise in the hotel, so we and our baby slept very soundly. At first, I thought that we must have an inside room because there was no outside noise at all, but, I looked out the window to find out that we were right on the side along the freeway! I don't know how anyone could have been bothered by this previously! Housekeeping was awesome - every day our room looked brand new. One day, we stayed in the room until 1pm with the Do Not Disturb sign up, so they slid a letter under the door saying that because of this, they wouldn't be able to service the room, but to call if we needed anything. No problem, we understood. We left thinking that we would just order some new towels when we got back - instead, it was completely cleaned once again by the time we returned! How awesome was that! I have no complaints whatsoever with this hotel; I would gladly stay there again. I'm sure traffic to the stadium is horrible on game-day, but, it's that way no matter how you get there. Luckily, this hotel is so close to the freeway, it has to be easy to avoid stadium traffic when not headed to the game. I highly recommend this as an economy hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego - Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 3805 Murphy Canyon Road, San Diego, CA 92123
